content.en: Healthcare Machine Learning: Machine learning is being used to address challenges in healthcare informatics by offering tools and techniques to handle data. It is assisting in administrative processes, disease treatment, and personalized medicine in the healthcare sector. Machine learning has the potential to enable high-value decision-making in healthcare, but methodological issues, reporting standards, and institutional adoption need to be addressed. Clinicians and researchers need to be empowered to critically appraise machine learning studies in healthcare. Evidence-based medicine and machine learning can complement each other in improving clinical decision-making. Multi-modal workflows and comprehensive consideration of AI technologies can reduce bias and potential harms in clinical care. Guidelines and checklists can facilitate communication and evaluation of AI research in healthcare. Availability of curated data sets, reliable interpretation of models, and reproducibility are significant impediments in adopting AI in medical care. AI and ML promise to transform medicine, but concerns include data reliability, decreased human interaction, and cost-benefit skepticism. AI and ML technologies have the potential to enhance cancer care, but addressing bias is crucial for promoting health equity. AI has become a daily presence in healthcare, complementing clinical practice and improving patient care. A hybrid human-machine intelligence method, involving physicians in the ML process, can enhance predictive models in healthcare. Ensuring meaningful results, improved state of the art, and well-defined clinical problems are key challenges in applying machine learning to healthcare. Quality of data inputs, interpretability, transparency, and ethical concerns are important considerations in using machine learning in healthcare research. Machine learning has the potential to improve healthcare, but biases and equitable implementation must be addressed.
content.da: Sundhedsvæsenets Maskinlæring: Maskinlæring bruges til at løse udfordringer inden for sundhedsinformatik ved at tilbyde værktøjer og teknikker til at håndtere data. Det hjælper med administrative processer, behandling af sygdomme og personlig medicin i sundhedssektoren. Maskinlæring har potentialet til at muliggøre beslutningstagning af høj værdi i sundhedsvæsenet, men metodologiske spørgsmål, rapporteringsstandarder og institutionel adoption skal adresseres. Klinikere og forskere skal have mulighed for kritisk at vurdere maskinlæringsstudier i sundhedsvæsenet. Evidensbaseret medicin og maskinlæring kan supplere hinanden i forbedringen af klinisk beslutningstagning. Multi-modale arbejdsgange og en omfattende overvejelse af AI-teknologier kan reducere bias og potentielle skader i klinisk pleje. Retningslinjer og tjeklister kan lette kommunikationen og evalueringen af AI-forskning i sundhedsvæsenet. Tilgængeligheden af kuraterede datasæt, pålidelig fortolkning af modeller og reproducerbarhed er væsentlige hindringer i implementeringen af AI i medicinsk pleje. AI og ML lover at transformere medicin, men bekymringer inkluderer datatilforladelighed, reduceret menneskelig interaktion og skepsis over omkostninger i forhold til fordele. AI- og ML-teknologier har potentialet til at forbedre kræftbehandling, men at tackle bias er afgørende for at fremme sundhedslighed. AI er blevet en daglig tilstedeværelse i sundhedsvæsenet, supplere klinisk praksis og forbedre patientpleje. En hybrid metode med menneske-maskine intelligens, der involverer læger i ML-processen, kan forbedre prædiktive modeller i sundhedsvæsenet. At sikre meningsfulde resultater, forbedret state of the art og veldefinerede kliniske problemer er nøgleudfordringer i anvendelsen af maskinlæring i sundhedssektoren. Kvaliteten af datainput, tolkning, gennemsigtighed og etiske bekymringer er vigtige overvejelser i brugen af maskinlæring i sundhedsforskning. Maskinlæring har potentialet til at forbedre sundhedsvæsenet, men skævheder og retfærdig implementering skal adresseres.
